result.execSummary:
The defendant Raekwon Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raekwon Dixon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raekwon Dixon was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined at hearing on October 21, 2015.

Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.
Obtain high school diploma.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with Bradley T.
Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes all terms and conditions of probation.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: With Huber release privileges for school.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 9/21/2015 at 5:00 p.m.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raekwon Dixon

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Raekwon Dixon not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments heard regarding restitution.  Court finds it can not be established that this defendant is to be held responsible for restitution.  Court sets restitution at $0.

Defendant Raekwon Dixon in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 33 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 30 MONTHS with the following conditions:

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Restitution to be determined  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain high school diploma 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with Bradley T.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes all terms and conditions of probation
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 60 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for school.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 9/21/2015 at 5:00 p.m. 
 
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Raekwon Dixon in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. State needs to conduct victim notification.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List received and filed.

Defendant Raekwon Dixon in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.   Parties may have resolved this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Raekwon Dixon in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request a Jury Trial and a Final Pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raekwon Dixon in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense awaiting additional discovery; request for status date granted.
Justice Point report reviewed with the parties.  Defendant missed scheduled telephone contact; no action requested by the state.  The Court admonishes the defendant.  Status date selected with the parties.

  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Raekwon Dixon in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/4/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raekwon Dixon in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Raekwon Dixon in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
